page.title: 12Museum of Army Flying.
page.content: Situated on the airfield at the Army's main flying training school at Middle Wallop is the new and greatly enlarged Museum of Army Flying. The Museum displays aspects of military flying from the earliest man carrying kites and balloons, to the latest missile firing jet powered helicopter.There are special displays of early helicopters, WW2 Glider Operations, the Falklands Conflict and post war operations. Inaugerated by HRH Prince Michael of Kent in July 1984, the Museum is in its first full year of operation and hopes to attract a large number of tourists and day visitors to the area.
